newsitem.title: USA: FAA to order inspections of Boeing 767 wing flaps.
newsitem.headline: FAA to order inspections of Boeing 767 wing flaps.

text.p: U.S. officials said on Tuesday they were preparing an order to inspect wing flaps on Boeing Co 767s after an incident in which a 18-foot flap section fell off as a 767 approached a landing at Dallas.
Federal Aviation Administration officials said about 200 older 767s would be covered by the airworthiness order, to be issued soon.
They said it would direct airlines flying the 767s to conduct the flap inspections, but gave no details.
There were no injuries in the incident on March 27, either on the Delta Air Lines Inc 767, which landed safely, or on the ground.
The flap section fell into a field near a major intersection in the Dallas suburb of Carrollton, near a residential area and a nursing home.
